snippet: Debt held by those 65 and older has risen significantly in recent years, but the load may be eased with careful planning or government aid, or through an employer.
abstract: Government Accountability Office reports student debt accumulated by Americans 65 and older has grown to about $18.2 billion in 2013, from about $2.8 billion in 2005; while some of that can be attributed to co-signing loans for children and grandchildren, good measure of it is for continuing education; experts offer ways for adult college students to manage debt.
lead_paragraph: Debt held by those 65 and older has risen significantly in recent years, but the load may be eased with careful planning or government aid, or through an employer.

headline.main: Managing Student Loan Debt as an Older Adult
